Sentence.sentence: The Millennium Ecosystem Assessment, a vast four-year global study which reported its initial conclusions earlier this year, found reasons to believe that managing ecosystems sustainably—working with nature rather than against it—might be less profitable in the short term, but certainly brings long-term rewards.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In a study published in Nature Scientific Reports, we reveal just how deep this  injustice runs.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: When we can't actually remove the source of our fear, we tend to adapt psychologically by adopting a range of defence mechanisms, says Tom Crompton, change strategist for the environmental organisation World Wide Fund for Nature.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I’d like to look at a vital aspect of e-commerce, and that is the nature of the product or service.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But in the course of trying to do so, they generated a lot of ideas about the nature of the problems and about what potential solutions would look like.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They are ways to communicate with nature.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This is especially true of editors, who by nature tend to be eager and engaged participants in everything they do.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That's because the quest for a unified theory that would account for all the forces of nature has pushed current mathematics to its limits.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is a result of both nature and nurture.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Finding the true nature of subatomic particles

Sentence.sentence: Changing attitudes toward nature.

Sentence.sentence: Scientists have also found that nature seems to give another boost to girls.

Sentence.sentence: According to scientists, what is another advantage given to girls by nature
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Aristotle and Socrates debated the nature of "akrasia"一our tendency to do things against our interests.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Biologist Jill Farrant of the University of Cape Town in South Africa says that nature has plenty of answers for people who want to grow crops in places with unpredictable rainfall.

Sentence.sentence: Changing your beliefs about the nature of your self-control can have positive effects on character development.

Sentence.sentence: I'd like to look at a vital aspect of e-commerce, and that is the nature of the product or service.

Sentence.sentence: If you take a look at his biography, you can get a good idea of how his life experiences manifest themselves in his theories of beauty, specifically, the way he looked towards nature as the origin of what we find beautiful.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: I'm really more interested in nature than beauty.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: In a 2016 study published in the journal Nature Neuroscience, Ariely and colleagues showed how dishonesty alters people's brains, making it easier to tell lies in the future.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In a study published in Nature Scientific Reports, we reveal just how deep this injustice runs.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In her work, she revealed a side of nature so exotic, dramatic and valuable to Europeans of the time that she received much acclaim.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: In the images, you see all kinds of possible defense constructions to hold back the Romans, Germans, Vikings, and now nature as enemy number one.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Still, if you're interested in nature, then that certainly can be worked into your dissertation.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: The knowledge she collected over decades didn't just satisfy those curious about nature, but also provided valuable insights into medicine and science.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The millennium Ecosystem Assessment, a vast four-year global study which reported its initial conclusions earlier this year, found reasons to believe that managing ecosystems sustainably—working with nature rather than against it—might be less profitable
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The Nature Conservancy has declared war on a multitude of invasive species here, from sheep to plants to the aggressive Argentine ant.

Sentence.sentence: The topic of the nature of skill—and the differences between beginners and experts has been one of considerable discussion in cognitive science and philosophy.

Sentence.sentence: There's this peer-to-peer nature of health care these days with a profound opportunity for parents to learn helpful tips, safety and prevention efforts, pro-vaccine messages and all kinds of other messages from other parents in their social communities.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"性格，气质，性情，习性"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: temper, character, nature, personality, disposition, complexion
means: temper ： 指从感情方面体现出来，决定处理问题或应付形势的方式的性格或性情，这种性情可以是暂时的也可以长久的。
character ： 指对个性或人格所作出的客观评价，常常与道德有关。
nature ： 指天生的、不可改变性格。
personality ： 主要指一个人稳定的心理特征。
disposition ： 书面用词，指人的主要爱好或思想、精神方面的重要习性、气质。也可指短暂的情绪。
complexion ： 指由思维方式、态度和情绪所决定的本质特征。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 同词源的,同类的;同种的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cog同+nat出生的,本土的+e→同生的
in进+nat出生的,本土的+e→与出生一起进来→天赋的
nat出生的,本土的+al……的→adj.出生的
natal[adj.出生的]+ity表名词→n.出生率,出生
nat出生的,本土的+ion表名词→出生之处
nation民族,国家+ality表名词→n.国籍,民族
nat本土的+ive人→n.本地人,本国人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 自然界,大自然;性质,本性,天性
stems_affixes.word_buile: nat出生的,本土的+ure表名词→出生状态→天性
neo新+nat出生的,本土的+e→新出生

Sentence.sentence: A Swiss study reported that while the weight of electronic goods represented by precious metals was relatively small in comParison to total waste, the concentration of gold and other precious metals was higher in so-called e-waste than in nature.

Sentence.sentence: After all, the scientist is engaged in serious research to uncover the very nature of the physical world.

Sentence.sentence: Before modern medicine changed the laws of nature, many children died of common childhood diseases.

Sentence.sentence: He believes design must take into account the sensory side of our nature—sight, smell, touch and taste.

Sentence.sentence: However, instead of taking care of his business, john was often off exploring nature.

Sentence.sentence: Human life is regarded as part of nature and, as such, the only way for us to survive is to live in harmony with nature.

Sentence.sentence: In these places patients can go to be near nature during their recovery.

Sentence.sentence: It can uncover laws of nature, cure diseases, make bombs, and help bridges to stand up.

Sentence.sentence: It must be true that sooner or later, everyone finds his or her way back to nature.

Sentence.sentence: My nature-loving friends had remembered to bring all the necessities of life.

Sentence.sentence: Nature seems to unfold to people who watch and wait.

Sentence.sentence: Some were political in nature, criticizing the church and government.

Sentence.sentence: The Internet has made data abundant, all-present and far more valuable, changing the nature of data and competition.

Sentence.sentence: The need to be close to nature.

Sentence.sentence: The passage is mainly about cooperation as a distinctive human nature.

Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: This nature of data makes the antitrust measures of the past less useful.

Sentence.sentence: Allen‘s contribution was to take an assumption we all share-that because we are not robots we therefore control our thoughts-and reveal its erroneous nature.

Sentence.sentence: But what will be the nature of that difference? Merely expanding the orchestra’s repertoire will not be enough.

Sentence.sentence: Human nature being what it is, most people stick with default settings.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Beethoven’s importance in music has been principally defined by the revolutionary nature of his compositions.

Sentence.sentence: As Nature has pointed out before, there are some legitimate concerns about how science prizes—both new and old—are distributed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This movement, driven by powerful and diverse motivations, built a nation out of a wilderness and, by its nature, shaped the character and destiny of an uncharted continent.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: It allows us to see the beauty that surrounds us each moment in nature,in culture,in the flow of our daily lives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: Although technology might change the way we react, it hasn't changed our nature.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But the Nobel Foundation's limit of three recipients per prize, each of whom must still be living, has long been outgrown by the collaborative nature of modern research—as will be demonstrated by the inevitable row over who is ignored when it comes to ack
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Critics make three main arguments against gene patents: a gene is a product of nature, so it may not be patented; gene patents suppress innovation rather than reward it; and patents'monopolies restrict access to genetic tests such as Myriad's.
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Human nature being what is, most people stick with default settings.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: If we readjust our view of arguments—from a verbal fight or tennis game to a reasoned exchange through which we all gain mutual respect, and understanding—then we change the very nature of what it means to "win" an argument.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: Regrettably, however, the report's failure to address the true nature of the crisis facing liberal education may cause more harm than good.

sentences.en: She has a good nature.
sentences.cn: 她性情温和。

sentences.cn: 铁和木头的性质不同。

sentences.en: I think he's a physicist or something of that nature.
sentences.cn: 我想他大概是物理学家或那一类的人。</seg>

means.word_mean: 大自然,自然界,自然力,自然体系

jx.jx_cn_mean: 不合常情的，反常的；邪恶的

jx.jx_en_mean: the good side of a person's character; their capacity for tolerance, generosity, or sympathy

lj.lj_ly: Charlotte planned to appeal to his better nature.
lj.lj_ls: 夏洛特打算求助于他善良的一面。

jx.jx_en_mean: used euphemistically to refer to a need to urinate or defecate
(in art) using natural scenes or objects as models
return to the type of life (regarded as being more in tune with nature) that existed before the development of complex industrial societies
similar in type to or having the characteristics of

lj.lj_ly: a week at home would be in the nature of a holiday.
lj.lj_ls: 在家里待一周和度假没什么区别。

lj.lj_ly: it is in the nature of things that the majority of music prizes get set up for performers rather than composers.
lj.lj_ls: 大部分的音乐奖项理所当然是为演奏者而不是为作曲者设立的。

lj.lj_ly: in the nature of things, old people spend much more time indoors.
lj.lj_ls: 当然，老年人在室内时间多得多。

jx.jx_en_mean: in an uncivilized or uncultivated state
jx.jx_cn_mean: 未开化状态的；野生状态的

jx.jx_en_mean: (Christian Theology)in a morally unregenerate condition, unredeemed by divine grace
jx.jx_cn_mean: (基督教神学)未得神恩的有罪状态

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)the inherent or essential quality or character of something, which cannot be changed

entry.def: Nature is all the animals, plants, and other things in the world that are not made by people, and all the events and processes that are not caused by people.

example.ex: The most amazing thing about nature is its infinite variety.
example.tran: 大自然最让人惊叹的是它的无限多样性。
自然界里各种野生的草

entry.def: The nature of something is its basic quality or character.

example.ex: Mr Sharp would not comment on the nature of the issues being investigated.
example.tran: 夏普先生不愿就被调查问题的性质发表评论。

entry.def: Someone's nature is their character, which they show by the way they behave.

example.ex: Jeya feels that her ambitious nature made her unsuitable for an arranged marriage...
example.tran: 耶娅觉得她不安分的个性不适合包办的婚姻。

example.ex: She trusted people. That was her nature...
example.tran: 她信任别人，这是她的天性。

entry.def: If you say that something is against nature, you think that it is unnatural.

example.ex: All these activities are against nature.
example.tran: 所有这些活动都是违背常理的。

entry.def: If you want to get back to nature, you want to return to a simpler way of living.

example.ex: She was very anxious to get away from cities and back to nature.
example.tran: 她特别渴望离开城市，回归自然。

entry.def: If you say that something has a particular characteristic by its nature or by its very nature, you mean that things of that type always have that characteristic.
entry.tran: 按其固有的性质;就其本质

example.ex: Peacekeeping, by its nature, makes pre-planning difficult...
example.tran: 维和行动本身的特点决定了预先制订计划很困难。

example.ex: One could argue that smoking, by its very nature, is addictive.
example.tran: 有人可能认为抽烟从本质上说就具有成瘾性。

entry.def: Some people talk about a call of nature when referring politely to the need to go to the toilet.
entry.tran: (委婉说法)内急，需要去洗手间

example.ex: I'm afraid I have to answer a call of nature.

entry.def: If you say that something is in the nature of things, you mean that you would expect it to happen in the circumstances mentioned.

example.ex: Of course, in the nature of things, and with a lot of drinking going on, people failed to notice...
example.tran: 喝了那么多酒，大家当然没能察觉到。

example.ex: Many have already died, and in the nature of things many more will die.
example.tran: 很多人已经死去，更多的人势必也将会死去。

entry.def: If you say that one thing is in the nature of another, you mean that it is like the other thing.
entry.tran: 具有…性质的;与…类似的;…之类的

example.ex: There is movement towards, I think, something in the nature of a pluralistic system...
example.tran: 我想，出现了某种向类似多元体系转变的趋势。

example.ex: It was in the nature of a debate rather than an argument.
example.tran: 那更像是一场辩论，而不是争吵。

entry.def: If a way of behaving is second nature to you, you do it almost without thinking because it is easy for you or obvious to you.

example.ex: Planning ahead had always come as second nature to her...
example.tran: 预先计划一直是她的习惯。

example.ex: It's  not easy at first, but it soon becomes second nature.
example.tran: 起初不容易，但很快就习惯了。

means.word_mean: 1. the essential qualities or characteristics by which something is recognized;

sentences.sentence: "it is the nature of fire to burn"

means.word_mean: 2. a causal agent creating and controlling things in the universe;

sentences.sentence: "nature has seen to it that men are stronger than women"

means.word_mean: 3. the natural physical world including plants and animals and landscapes etc.;

sentences.sentence: "they tried to preserve nature as they found it"

means.word_mean: 4. the complex of emotional and intellectual attributes that determine a person's characteristic actions and reactions;

sentences.sentence: "it is his nature to help others"
"problems of this type are very difficult to solve"
"he's interested in trains and things of that nature"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting the physical power of a person): from Old French, from Latin natura 'birth, nature, quality', from nat- 'born', from the verb nasci

sentences.cn: 大自然最让人惊叹的是它的无限多样性。
sentences.en: The most amazing thing about nature is its infinite variety.

sentences.cn: 自然界里各种野生的草
sentences.en: ...grasses that grow wild in nature.

sentences.cn: 夏普先生不愿就被调查问题的性质发表评论。
sentences.en: Mr Sharp would not comment on the nature of the issues being investigated.

sentences.cn: 雄心勃勃的计划
sentences.en: ...the ambitious nature of the programme...

sentences.cn: 耶娅觉得她不安分的个性不适合包办的婚姻。
sentences.en: Jeya feels that her ambitious nature made her unsuitable for an arranged marriage...

sentences.cn: 她信任别人，这是她的天性。
sentences.en: She trusted people. That was her nature...

sentences.cn: 所有这些活动都是违背常理的。
sentences.en: All these activities are against nature.

sentences.cn: 她特别渴望离开城市，回归自然。
sentences.en: She was very anxious to get away from cities and back to nature.

sentences.cn: 维和行动本身的特点决定了预先制订计划很困难。
sentences.en: Peacekeeping, by its nature, makes pre-planning difficult...

sentences.cn: 有人可能认为抽烟从本质上说就具有成瘾性。
sentences.en: One could argue that smoking, by its very nature, is addictive.

sentences.cn: 抱歉我要去趟洗手间。
sentences.en: I'm afraid I have to answer a call of nature.

sentences.cn: 喝了那么多酒，大家当然没能察觉到。
sentences.en: Of course, in the nature of things, and with a lot of drinking going on, people failed to notice...

sentences.cn: 很多人已经死去，更多的人势必也将会死去。
sentences.en: Many have already died, and in the nature of things many more will die.

sentences.cn: 我想，出现了某种向类似多元体系转变的趋势。
sentences.en: There is movement towards, I think, something in the nature of a pluralistic system...

sentences.cn: 那更像是一场辩论，而不是争吵。
sentences.en: It was in the nature of a debate rather than an argument.

sentences.cn: 预先计划一直是她的习惯。
sentences.en: Planning ahead had always come as second nature to her...

sentences.cn: 起初不容易，但很快就习惯了。
sentences.en: It's  not easy at first, but it soon becomes second nature.

sentences.en: the beauties of nature

sentences.en: nature conservation

sentences.cn: 自然力 / 规律
sentences.en: the forces/laws of nature

sentences.cn: 就顺其自然吧。
sentences.en: Just let nature take its course.

sentences.cn: 年轻人常常会反抗他们的父母，这很自然。
sentences.en: In the nature of things, young people often rebel against their parents.

sentences.cn: 大自然最让人惊叹的是它的无限多样性。
sentences.en: The most amazing thing about nature is its infinite variety.

sentences.cn: 自然界里各种野生的草
sentences.en: ...grasses that grow wild in nature.

sentences.cn: 她特别渴望离开城市，回归自然。
sentences.en: She was very anxious to get away from cities and back to nature.

sentences.cn: 就像《自然》杂志新闻专栏中的一篇文章所述，最近几年出现了一系列奖金和诺贝尔奖一样丰厚的科学奖项。
sentences.en: As a News Feature article in Nature discusses, a string of lucrative awards for researchers have joined the Nobel Prizes in recent years.

sentences.cn: 正如《自然》杂志之前指出的那样，人们对于新、旧科学奖项的分配方法存在一些合理的担忧。
sentences.en: As Nature has pointed out before, there are some legitimate concerns about how science prizes—both new and old—are distributed.

sentences.cn: 批评家们反对基因专利的原因主要有三点：基因是自然的产物，因此它不能被授予专利；基因专利压制了创新，而不是鼓励创新；基因专利的垄断限制了其他的基因测试，例如麦利亚徳基因公司案。
sentences.en: Critics make three main arguments against gene patents: a gene is a product of nature, so it may not be patented; gene patents suppress innovation rather than reward it; and patents' monopolies restrict access to genetic tests such as Myriad's.

sentences.cn: 10 月，司法部对麦利亚德案做出简短声明，认为单离脱氧核糖核酸分子“如同从棉花籽中分离出的棉花纤维一样，都是自然的产物。”
sentences.en: In October the Department of Justice filed a brief in the Myriad case, arguing that an isolated DNA molecule “is no less a product of nature... than arecotton fibres that have been separated from cotton seeds.”

sentences.cn: 环保组织世界自然基金会的改革策略分析师 Tom Crompton 说：“当我们不能真正地移除产生恐惧的根源，往往会倾向于采取一系列防御机制让心理适应”。
sentences.en: “ When we can ’ t actually remove the source of our fear, we tend to adapt  psychologically by adopting a range of defence  mechanisms , ” says Tom Crompton, change  strategist for the environmental organisation World Wide Fund for Nature.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 在《自然》子刊《科学报告》上发表的一篇研究中，我们揭露了这个不公平的现象是多么严重。
sentences.en: In  a  study  published in  Nature Scientific Reports,  we  reveal  just  how  deep  this injustice runs.
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 在照片里，你可以看见各种各样能用来抵御罗马人、日耳曼人、维京人以及大自然这个当下的头号敌人的防御建筑。
sentences.en: In the images, you see all kinds of possible defense constructions to hold back the Romans, Germans, Vikings, and now nature as enemy number one.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 这看上去是不是自然界中存在的东西？
sentences.en: Does it look like something that might occur in nature?

sentences.cn: 研究人员在《自然气候变化》的网站上发表的报告中说，自1865 年以来，海洋吸收的热量中约有一半发生在1997 年以后。
sentences.en: Around  half of ocean heat intake since 1865 has taken place since 1997, researchers report online in Nature Climate Change.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 秋天,大自然的色彩最为丰富.
sentences.en: Nature is most colourful in autumn.

sentences.cn: 砷广泛分布于自然界,而且是一种重要的环境污染物.
sentences.en: Arsenic is widely distributed in nature and also an important environmental pollutant.

sentences.cn: 桥梁的三种基本类型来自于自然的灵感.
sentences.en: The 3 basic types of bridges are all inspired by forms in nature.

sentences.cn: 只有在城市以外,自然 、 地理 、 气候才达到它们最大的效应.
sentences.en: It is outside the cities that nature, geography, climate, have their maximum impact.

sentences.cn: 女巫和男巫们比他们的麻瓜伙计们都要更接近自然.
sentences.en: Witches and wizards are closer to Nature than their Muggle counterparts.

sentences.cn: 对于怎样才能发现自然界的这些简化图式,并没有什么万能的方法.
sentences.en: There is no universal prescription for discovering these simplifying patterns of nature.

sentences.cn: 这显然不合乎常理, 但又显然是一股推动自然的力量.
sentences.en: That is clearly irrational, yet that is clearly a force that drives nature.

sentences.cn: 大自然创造万物没有一件是盲目的或是无用的.
sentences.en: Nature does nothing without purpose or uselessly.

sentences.cn: 秋月向来受到诗人和热爱大自然的人们的宠爱.
sentences.en: The autumn moon has always been a favourite with poets and lovers of nature.

sentences.cn: 谋杀是一种有违天性的罪行。
sentences.en: Murder is a crime against nature.

sentences.cn: 她信任别人，这是她的天性。
sentences.en: She trusted people. That was her nature...

sentences.cn: 尽管科技可能改变我们的反应方式，但它还没有改变我们的天性。
sentences.en: Although technology might change the way we react, it hasn’t changed our nature.

sentences.cn: 人们天性好奇。
sentences.en: People are curious by nature.

sentences.cn: 到处都能发现竞争,因为渴望更好是人的天性.
sentences.en: Competition is found everywhere because it is human inborn nature to long for the better.

sentences.cn: 嫉妒是最可怕的东西,它会毁坏人的天性.
sentences.en: Jealousy is the most terrible thing and will spoil anybody's nature.

sentences.cn: 她的随和的天性使她能与任何人相处.
sentences.en: Her facile nature adapted itself to any company.

sentences.cn: 我们周围的天性遵照这个调和比例.
sentences.en: Nature around us follows this harmonious relationship.

sentences.cn: 然而,尽管喀洛斯和穆赛德斯相处融洽和谐, 他们的天性却彼此不同.
sentences.en: But though Kalos and Musides dwelt in unbroken harmony, their natures were not alike.

sentences.cn: 银行出于天性借短期 ( 从储户及资金批发市场 ) 贷长期.
sentences.en: By their nature, banks borrow short ( from depositors or the wholesale markets ) and lend long.

sentences.cn: 她与大家相处很好,因为她的天性柔和.
sentences.en: She gets along well with people because of her supple nature.

sentences.cn: 闲谈是人类的天性.
sentences.en: Gossiping is human nature.

sentences.cn: 他们争论是天性更重要还是培养更重要.
sentences.en: They debated whether nature or nurture was more important.

sentences.cn: 所以这是惊人的, 工具性和规范的天性.
sentences.en: So it is phenomenal, instrumental and normative by nature.

sentences.cn: 所有这些无休无尽的良好天性都会激怒那些更含蓄国家的来访者.
sentences.en: All this boundless good nature can grate on visitors from more reserved nations.

sentences.cn: 生而为人的天性, 就是昂首阔步, 无所畏惧, 勇敢地面对风险.
sentences.en: Health and human nature, that is, moving forward, fearless, courageous to face the risks.

sentences.cn: 他如此长时间地从事教学,以至于教学已成了他的第二天性.
sentences.en: He's been teaching for so long that it's second nature to him.

sentences.cn: 人类的天性厌恶这样的罪恶.
sentences.en: Human nature revolts at such crime.

sentences.cn: 在这目光中他凝聚了他天性中的全部激情.
sentences.en: In them the whole intensity of the man's nature was distilling itself.

sentences.cn: 除去隐秘的天性, 她是个有才能的德鲁伊,能与别人很好的合作.
sentences.en: Despite her secretive nature, she is a talented druid who works well with others.

sentences.cn: 各尽其职、不管闲事是这些地区人的第二天性 ( 波士顿 )
sentences.en: Minding your own business is second nature in these parts ( Boston )

sentences.cn: 真正的男人接受性别赋予他的一切, 他从不为自己的天性而感到愧疚.
sentences.en: A man accepts the consequences of being male ; he makes no apologies for his nature.

sentences.cn: 美国人天性对于爱好和娱乐活动充满热情和活力.
sentences.en: By nature, Americans are enthusiastic and energetic about hobbies or pastimes.

sentences.cn: 他睿智恢宏, 推理能力惊人, 然而他表露感情的天性却有所不足.
sentences.en: His intelligence was great, his power of reasoning impressive, but his emotional nature was meager.

sentences.cn: Kind意思是宽大的 、 热心的 、 友好的 、 有同情心的或是乐于助人的天性 、 文雅的 、 仁慈的和温柔的.
sentences.en: KIND means forgiving, warm - hearted, friendly, of a sympathetic or helpful nature, gentle, merciful, and tender.

sentences.cn: 他明白,人类的天性所需要的教导不是每星期一次讲道理能解决的.
sentences.en: He knows that human nature needs more lessons than a weekly sermon can convey.

sentences.cn: 罗杰天性沉默寡言, 他一声不吭.
sentences.en: Roger, uncommunicative by nature, said nothing.

sentences.cn: 腾格拉尔向弗尔南多看了看, 只见他易于激动的天性把每一个新的感受都明显地表露在脸上.
sentences.en: Danglars looked towards Fernand, whose excitable nature received and betrayed each fresh impression.

sentences.cn: 所有这些都可归结为一点——人的天性.
sentences.en: It all boils down to one thing — human nature.

sentences.cn: 弗雷德里克 和皮尔金顿说,正是在这一点上,造反是悖于天理的.
